qas.question: What was Bartolomeo Bortolazzi's popular mandolin method?

answers.text: Anweisung die Mandoline von selbst zu erlernen nebst einigen Uebungsstucken von Bortolazzi

qas.question: How many strings did the Cremonese Mandolin have?
Did Bortolazzi like playing the new wire strung mandolins?
What did Bortolazzi say about the sound?
Who didn't popularize the Cremonese Mandolin?

plausible_answers.text: Anweisung die Mandoline von selbst zu erlernen nebst einigen Uebungsstucken von Bortolazzi

qas.question: What was Bartolomeo Bortolazzi's unpopular mandolin method?
How many double strings did the Cremonese Mandolin have?
What did Bortolazzi say about the tempo?

context: In his 1805 mandolin method, <a1_0><b6_0>Anweisung die Mandoline von selbst zu erlernen nebst einigen Uebungsstucken von Bortolazzi<b6_0/><a1_0/>, <a0_0><b5_0>Bartolomeo Bortolazzi<b5_0/><a0_0/> popularised the Cremonese mandolin, which had <a2_0><b7_0>four<b7_0/> single-strings<a2_0/> and a fixed bridge, to which the strings were attached. Bortolazzi said in this book that the new wire strung mandolins were <a3_0>uncomfortable to play<a3_0/>, when compared with the gut-string instruments. Also, he felt they had a "<a4_0>less pleasing...hard, zither-like tone<a4_0/>" as compared to the gut string's "<b8_0>softer, full-singing tone<b8_0/>." He favored the four single strings of the Cremonese instrument, which were tuned the same as the Neapolitan.
